intro: Minuartia torosensis, commonly known as the Toros rockcress, is a small, flowering plant native to Turkey. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with characteristic cruciform flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. Its compact growth form and ability to thrive in harsh conditions make it a resilient species in its native habitat.
